# Support

Welcome to Cursor Boston! This document will help you find the right resources and support for your needs.

## Community Resources

### Discord Server

Our Discord server is the best place for real-time help and community interaction.

**Join us:** [discord.gg/Wsncg8YYqc](https://discord.gg/Wsncg8YYqc)

Discord is great for:
- Quick questions and answers
- Sharing what you're working on
- Connecting with other community members
- Getting help with development setup
- Discussing AI-powered development workflows

### Events

We host regular in-person and virtual events in the Boston area.

**Event calendar:** [lu.ma/cursor-boston](https://lu.ma/cursor-boston)

Events include:
- Monthly meetups
- Workshops and tutorials
- Hackathons
- Speaker sessions
- Networking events

### Website

Visit our website for information about the community and upcoming events.

**Website:** [cursorboston.com](https://cursorboston.com)

## Getting Help

### For General Questions

1. **Search existing resources first**
   - Check our [README](../README.md) for setup and usage information
   - Search [existing issues](https://github.com/rogerSuperBuilderAlpha/cursor-boston/issues) for similar questions
   - Review the [documentation](./) in the .github folder

2. **Ask on Discord**
   - Join our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/Wsncg8YYqc)
   - Post in the appropriate channel
   - Provide context about what you're trying to do

3. **Open a GitHub Discussion**
   - Use [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/rogerSuperBuilderAlpha/cursor-boston/discussions) for longer-form questions
   - Great for architectural discussions or feature ideas

### For Bug Reports

Found a bug? Please report it!

1. **Check existing issues** to avoid duplicates
2. **Use the bug report template** when [creating a new issue](https://github.com/rogerSuperBuilderAlpha/cursor-boston/issues/new?template=bug_report.md)
3. **Include**:
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Expected vs actual behavior
   - Screenshots if applicable
   - Your environment (OS, browser, Node version)

### For Feature Requests

Have an idea for a new feature?

1. **Check existing issues and discussions** to see if it's been proposed
2. **Use the feature request template** when [creating a new issue](https://github.com/rogerSuperBuilderAlpha/cursor-boston/issues/new?template=feature_request.md)
3. **Include**:
   - Clear description of the feature
   - Use cases and benefits
   - Any implementation ideas

### For Security Issues

**Do not report security vulnerabilities through public issues!**

Please see our [Security Policy](SECURITY.md) for instructions on reporting security vulnerabilities.

## Contributing

Interested in contributing to the project?

- Read our [Contributing Guide](CONTRIBUTING.md)
- Check out [good first issues](https://github.com/rogerSuperBuilderAlpha/cursor-boston/labels/good%20first%20issue)
- Review our [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- Learn about our [governance model](GOVERNANCE.md)

## Contact

### General Inquiries

**Email:** hello@cursorboston.com

Use this for:
- General questions about the community
- Partnership inquiries
- Speaking opportunities
- Press and media

### Code of Conduct Issues

**Email:** hello@cursorboston.com

All reports are confidential. See our [Code of Conduct](CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) for details.

### Security Vulnerabilities

**Email:** hello@cursorboston.com

See our [Security Policy](SECURITY.md) for the full disclosure process.

## Response Times

We're a volunteer-run community project. Here are our typical response times:

| Channel | Response Time |
|---------|---------------|
| Discord | Within 24-48 hours |
| GitHub Issues | Within 1 week |
| Email | Within 1 week |
| Security Issues | Within 48 hours |
